snippet: The Bayonne Medical Center billed Medicare for common treatments at a rate more than four times the national average, according to a Times analysis of 2011 data.
abstract: New York Times analysis of 2011 data shows that Bayonne Medical Center, in Bayonne, NJ, is the most expensive hospital in America; based on the bills it submits to Medicare it charged the highest amounts in the country for nearly one-quarter of the most common hospital treatments; quality of care at Bayonne Medical, for the prices it typically charges, is no better, or worse, than that at most other New Jersey hospitals.

byline.original: By JULIE CRESWELL, BARRY MEIER and JO CRAVEN McGINTY

lead_paragraph: The Bayonne Medical Center billed Medicare for common treatments at a rate more than four times the national average, according to a Times analysis of 2011 data.

headline.seo: Bayonne Medical Center Has Highest U.S. Billing Rates
headline.main: New Jersey Hospital Has Highest Billing Rates in the Nation
headline.print_headline:
Jersey Hospital
Is the Costliest
In the Nation
